ratings.comment: Go to lecture, but when he starts giving super complex examples, feel free to space out and take a nap. He doesn't use super complex examples on the test so no reason to pay attention. To ensure an A in the class, do all of the recommended homework and ask your TA or another TA for help if you don't understand. I repeat DO THE HOMEWORK.

He is my favourite professor. He is super cool and smart. He uses a lot of examples in the class which is very helpful. I just love him. You can definitely learn a lot if you pay attention to his examples and assignments.

A lot of people give him a poor rating, but I honestly didn't think he was bad. Calc is naturally a difficult subject, but the assignments he posts are extremely helpful. The guy is a genius, so sometimes his examples are extreme. Overall from what I've heard from other people about their professors he is very fair, especially with exams.

he spends too much time in lecture on proofs and simple examples that don't explain the tougher concepts. I got an A, but I pretty much stopped going to lecture completely and learned it on my own from the textbook. exams are pretty tough, but not obnoxiously hard. they focus a lot on definitions and theorems.

The class was very boring, and the lectures did not flow very smoothly.  Thank God I took Calc in high school because most of the students who didn't pretty much had to teach themselves. The assignments help ALOT as well as office hours. The exams were not that bad, but make sure you know all of the theorems and definitions involved.

Brown was a below average professor, but exams were not very challenging if you did the homework (or at least just looked at it). His lectures were pointless with a lot of proofs, but he was helpful in office hours and does practice exams the class period before the test. Fairly simple exams, but lecture was mostly a waste.

The class is really hard to start out with and in my opinion David Brown makes it worse. Use the book, don't bother going to lecture. You wont be able to follow what he is doing. I took AP Calc in high school so it was all review which made it much more do able. Class averages for exams were around 50%. He has mad flow and style though.
He is a REALLY NICE GUY and helpful during office hours. His class is hard and you have to self learn alot. Not exactly the best teacher but you do learn alot in the end. NOT AN EASY CLASS.
He is awful! Exam questions did not follow what he taught. His preparation did not follow what he included on the tests. His mannerisms are also annoying. DON'T TAKE HIM!!

He's terribly at explaining!!!You can hardly understand what he is trying to say! If you want to get a good grade, you'd better read the book and study by yourself or TAs may be helpful.... And his exams can be very hard. He likes you to prove thms on exams.. and his class notes are awful.

This is his first year teaching so you can't be too hard at him. The class is hard by the very nature of the work. His lectures are very hard to follow, but go to his office hours and he will slow down and be a lot more helpful.
Inconsistent exams -  some easy, some very hard. No comprehensive final. Go to office hours with any questions - extremely helpful one on one.
